text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This section has been updated to provide comprehensive guidance that addresses excise tax report writing. Content was added to be more cohesive, current and accurate.
The table below identiﬁes signiﬁcant changes in content:

4. 24.20.3.4 Unagreed Reports Title changed to Unagreed Excise Reports. Content about unagreed excise reports linked to the Excise Tax Knowledge Base Home Page. 4.24.20.3.5 Information Reports Title changed to Surveyed Excise Reports. New content added to address information about surveying an excise examination. Prior content moved to 4.24.20.3.8. New 4.24.20.3.6 Title added Audit Reconsideration and Reopening Excise Reports. New content added to address information about reconsideration and reopening an excise exami- nation. New 4.24.20.3.7 Title added Information Excise Reports. Content updated and transferred from 4.24.20.3.5. 4.24.20.4 Report Writing Guide- Title changed to Excise Report lines Writing Guidelines. 4.24.20.4.1 Reports in Notebook Title changed to Excise Reports and the Issue Management in Notebook and the Issue Man- System (IMS) agement System. Content updated about usage for Notebook and IMS. 4.24.20.4.2 Separate Reports for Title changed to Separate Excise Different Types of Excise Tax Reports for Different Types of Excise Tax. 4.24.20.4.3 Publications to Title changed to Publications to Include with Reports Include with Excise Reports. 4.24.20.4.4 Reports Sent to Au- Title changed to Excise Reports thorized Third Parties Sent to Authorized Third Parties. Content updated to incorporate material from IGM SB/SE 04- 0816-0044, Initial Taxpayer Contact in Excise Tax Examina- tion Cases. 4.24.20.4.4.1 Excise Tax Enclo- Content updated to incorporate sures with Correspondence to material from IGM SB/SE 04- Representatives and Appointees 1216-0057, Excise Tax Enclosures and Correspondence to Representatives and Appoin- tees.

4.24.20.4.5 Execution of Reports Title changed to Execution of and Payments Excise Reports and Payments. 4.24.20.4.6 Facsimile Signatures Content linked to include clariﬁca- tion memorandum issued on October 29, 2019, and revision memorandum issued on November 19, 2015.
Editorial changes were made throughout this IRM, such as updating electronic hyperlinks and IRM references.
This material supersedes IRM 4.24.20 dated May 19, 2017.
This section is for SB/SE excise tax managers (excise managers) and excise tax examiners (excise examiners).
Table of Contents
Instructions for Completing Form 5384 and Form 5385
Report Writing Guide
) General Overview - This IRM provides speciﬁc information and procedural guidance for excise examination reports (excise reports) in terms of content and and format. (

) Purpose - Excise reports should contain all information necessary to clear understanding of the adjustments proposed and document how the liability was computed. Executed excise reports (unlike workpapers) are binding documents and serve as the basis for assessment and collection actions. Based on this importance, excise managers and excise examiners must take all necessary steps to ensure excise report accuracy. (
) Audience - This IRM is for excise managers and excise examiners who prepare and process excise reports. (

) Policy Owner - Director, Examination - Specialty Policy is responsible for administration, procedures and updates related to the technical guidance information processing steps and methods speciﬁc to excise reports. (
) Program Owner - Director, Specialty Examination owns Excise Tax tion. (

) Primary Stakeholders - Appeals, Agency-Wide Shared Services, Counsel, SB/SE Specialty Examination, SB/SE Field and Specialty Exam Quality (FSEQ) and Large Business & International (LB&I) are the primary ers for this IRM. (
) The processes and procedures provided in this IRM are consistent with the objectives and goals for Excise Tax Examination that are addressed in IRM
, Organization and Staffing, Small Business and Self/Employed (SB/SE), Excise Tax Examination. (
) IRC

, Content of tax due, deﬁciencies, and other notices, requires notices describe the basis for and identify the amounts of tax due, interest, ditional amounts, additions to tax and assessable penalties included in notices. The notices speciﬁed include the ﬁrst letter of proposed deﬁciency fering a review by Appeals, a notice of deﬁciency and notices of tax due. the statutory requirement is limited to the speciﬁed notices, the conference port notes the desire of Congress the Service make every effort to improve clarity of all explanations sent to taxpayers. ) Director, Examination - Specialty Policy is responsible for Excise Tax tion policy and procedures. (
) Director, Examination - Specialty Examination is responsible for operational compliance. (

) Chief, Estate & Gift/Excise Tax Examination is responsible for ensuring information, such as the administration, procedures and updates related to technical guidance and information processing steps and methods speciﬁc excise reports, is communicated to and executed by excise examiners.
) Director, Examination - Specialty Policy is responsible for Excise Tax tion policy and procedures. (
) Director, Examination - Specialty Examination is responsible for examination operational compliance. (

) Chief, Estate & Gift/Excise Tax Examination is responsible for ensuring information, such as the administration, procedures and updates related to technical guidance and information processing steps and methods speciﬁc to excise reports, is communicated to and executed by excise examiners.
Excise (
) Program Goals - The processes and procedures in this IRM are with the objectives and goals for Excise Tax Examination that are and IRM

) Program Reports - Reporting of program objectives are included in, but limited to, Headquarters Examination Monthly Brieﬁngs, Program Manager Monthly Brieﬁngs, Examination Operational Reviews and Business Perfor- mance Reviews, which are provided by the Director, Examination - Policy. (

) Program Effectiveness - Program effectiveness is measured by the tion Quality Review Staff located in FSEQ, which supports the SB/SE improvement program utilizing the National Quality Review System to independent case reviews from a statistically valid sample of examination work. National, area and territory trend analyses on the quality attributes establish baselines to assess program performance, identify opportunities improve work processes, analyze causes for failure, assess the feasibility possible solutions and measure the success of quality improvement efforts. (
) Annual Review - Program Manager, Excise Tax Policy is responsible for reviewing the information in this IRM annually to ensure accuracy and consistent tax administration. (

) IRS formally adopted a Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) in June
, provides the nation’s taxpayers with a better understanding of their rights helps reinforce the fairness of the tax system. In
, Congress charged Commissioner with ensuring IRS employees are familiar with and act in dance with taxpayer rights as afforded by IRC

), Execution of in accordance with taxpayer rights. IRS employees must be informed taxpayer rights and be conscientious in the performance of their duties to honor, respect and must communicate effectively those rights that may reducing taxpayer burdens. IRS employees must administer the law with rity and fairness and exercise professional judgment in conducting activities. Refer to Pub
, Your Rights as a Taxpayer, for more (
) Excise reporting procedures are determined by examination ﬁndings of selected excise tax returns (excise returns). An excise report may be:
Excise reporting procedures are determined by examination ﬁndings of selected excise tax returns (excise returns). An excise report may be:
(05-19-2017) Overview of Excise Reports
At the conclusion of an excise examination, the excise examiner will discuss Examination’s ﬁndings with the taxpayer.
) The excise examiner contact information will be provided to the taxpayer for a second time when an excise report is issued. Refer to IRM
, Employee Contact Information, for additional guidance. (
) Except as otherwise provided in IRM
, the excise examiner must provide to the taxpayer Pub
, The Examination Process, with the ﬁrst ex- amination report and with Letter
Day Letter - Straight Deﬁciency or Over-Assessment for Excise Tax Examination Cases. (
) In attempts to reach agreement, Examination personnel have the authority and
In attempts to reach agreement, Examination personnel have the authority and obligation to reach a deﬁnite conclusion based on a balanced and impartial

evaluation of all evidence. This authority does not extend to consideration for the hazards of litigation. This is consistent with Policy Statement P-4-40, which encourages the disposition of tax differences at the lowest level. Refer to IRM 1.2.1.5.16, Servicewide Policies and Authorities, Policy Statements for the Examining Process, Policy Statement 4-40, for more detailed guidance.

) At the conclusion of the excise examination, the excise examiner will prepare the excise report, secure the taxpayer’s signature where the examination resulted in a tax deﬁciency or reduction of a claim amount and solicit payment, if a deﬁciency is due. The excise examiner will give one signed copy of the excise report to each taxpayer and, if appropriate, to the taxpayer’s represen- tative. The signed original excise report will be retained for the administrative
full. Note: Do not enter an agreement date when there is no signed agreement. If payment of tax and penalties is received in lieu of a signature, use Code
to close the case. Refer to IRM
, AIMS and Processing Instructions, Examined Closings, Survey Claims, and Assessments, No Signed Agreement, for more detailed guidance. (
) Excise reports will always be numbered as page

in every report package. When other forms or pages are included in an excise report, including worksheet computations, they should follow the basic report form in the secutive page numbering system. Form

-A, Explanation of Items, or Issue Summary Lead Sheet is to be sent to the taxpayer and includes for facts, law and argument, conclusion and taxpayer position. Exhibits will labeled alphabetically and schedules will be labeled numerically. (
) Regardless of the number of periods examined, one set of explanations, if needed, will be prepared. When reasons for an adjustment vary from period, they should be detailed in one explanation. (

) When the size of the excise report warrants a Table of Contents, it should prepared and inserted in the excise report immediately behind the basic form. Each item in the Table of Contents should be keyed to its page in the report. (
) Refer to Exhibit
, Instructions for Completing Form
and
, for details on completing excise reports. (
) Procedures under IRM
, Corrected Reports, will be followed for corrected report writing, processing and closing. (
) The excise examination ﬁndings control the type of excise report prepared issued. This section provides general information about excise reports on type of closure. (
) Refer to IRM
, Closing Procedures by Type of Closure, for guidance about closing forms, letters and procedures per type of closure.
Refer to IRM 4.24.21.5, Closing Procedures by Type of Closure, for detailed guidance about closing forms, letters and procedures per type of closure.
Tax Report Writing Guide
) In an agreed excise examination, the taxpayer agrees to the adjustments proposed by the excise examiner. An agreed excise report is prepared. Reports (
) Form
, Excise Tax Examination Changes and Consent to Assessment Collection, is prepared for agreed cases when the taxpayer indicated agreement. The taxpayer signs Form
to establish agreement. (
) If a written explanation is needed for clariﬁcation of the excise examiner’s ﬁndings or requested by the taxpayer, Form
-A or Excise Issue Lead Sheet, should be issued. (
) Letter
-X, Letter to Transmit Expected Agreed Examination Report, be issued on an agreed case when the taxpayer indicated probable with the proposed examination changes. The response date added to
-X is determined by the excise examiner based on the facts and stances of the case. When a taxpayer does not respond to Letter
-X within the requested time frame, the excise examiner should follow up with taxpayer to determine if unagreed case procedures should be initiated. to IRM
), Report Writing, Regular Agreed Cases (SB/SE Field Office Examiners Only), for more detailed guidance. (
) If the taxpayer does not agree or if the excise examiner is uncertain if the taxpayer will agree or if the taxpayer does not respond within a reasonable amount of time after issuance of Form
, the excise examiner with the excise manager’s concurrence is to follow the unagreed report procedures under IRM
) Refer to IRM

(
) In an excepted agreed case, the taxpayer agrees to the proposed but the excise examination results are subject to review, additional or some other condition communicated to the taxpayer. Agreed (

) A partially agreed case is an excepted agreed case when it contains two more issues of which the taxpayer agrees with at least one issue and does agree with at least one other issue. A partially agreed excise report is prepared. Note: An unagreed excise report is prepared anytime there is a proposed ment to which the taxpayer does not agree. If the taxpayer requests an Appeals conference and the case is eligible, the unagreed excise report sent to Appeals. Refer to IRM
, Appeals Referral Procedures, Appeals Process, for additional guidance. (

, Report Transmittal, in all partially agreed cases but do provide this to the taxpayer. Refer to Rev. Proc.

examinations. (
) In a no change examination, the excise examiner determines there is no change to the reported tax liability. (

, which is issued to the taxpayer, serves as the no change report. A signed agreement is not required for a no change report. (

Unagreed Reports Book at Unagreed Case for detailed guidance about forms, letters and procedures for unagreed excise examinations. (

) A case will be closed “Survey after Assignment” if, after analyzing the excise return and without contacting the taxpayer or representative or reviewing any books or records, the excise examiner believes that an examination of the excise return would result in no material change in excise tax liability. Note: This authority extends to excise returns identiﬁed for examination on Form
, Referral Report. (

) Under certain conditions, a return may be surveyed after the taxpayer has been contacted, but before records have been inspected. This may include situations where the taxpayer is deceased, has a terminal illness, or there are other extraordinary circumstances that may warrant the survey of the return. Letter
, Return Accepted as Filed, must be issued if a decision is made survey the return after taxpayer contact. (
) To survey an excise return after assignment, the excise examiner completes Form
, Examination Non Examined Closings. (

) To support the survey after assignment, the excise examiner must document all actions that led to this decision, including but not limited to consideration Large, Unusual or Questionable Items, completion of required ﬁling checks, consideration of collectibility, evaluation of examination potential, repetitive aminations and other materials that inﬂuenced his or her decision. (
) Paper surveys are required for unpaid claims and cases with the original excise returns in the case ﬁle. If not required, paperless surveys may be utilized. (
) Certain non-examined cases can be closed in a virtually paperless fashion, if the original excise return was never requested. Only a Form
and Form
Document Transmittal, are required. Generally, this process is used the excise return was established on AIMS using an electronic print and the original return was never requested. Form
, Survey After Assignment - Excise or Employment Tax, must also be prepared and included in the IMS case ﬁle for all surveyed returns. (
) Refer to IRM
, Unpaid Claims - Survey, IRM
, Survey of an Excise Tax Return, IRM
, Survey of Return and sequent Pick Up of a Later Period, IRM

, Survey of Excise Tax Cases, and/or the Excise Tax Knowledge Base Homepage, Excise Examina- tion Shelf, Closing an Examination Chapter, Survey at Survey for detailed ance about closing forms, letters and procedures for surveying excise examinations. (
) When the taxpayer requests an audit reconsideration, report writing found in IRM
, Audit Reconsideration, Area Office (AO) Examination, apply. (
) A regular excise report will be prepared, if the excise return has been reopened. Refer to IRM
, AIMS Procedures and Processing Reopening/Reclosing/Reinputting Records, for procedural guidance on how to reopen and reclose cases that were previously closed. Internal Revenue Manual

A case will be closed “Survey after Assignment” if, after analyzing the excise return and without contacting the taxpayer or representative or reviewing any books or records, the excise examiner believes that an examination of the excise return would result in no material change in excise tax liability.

Certain non-examined cases can be closed in a virtually paperless fashion, if the original excise return was never requested. Only a Form 5351 and Form 3210 Document Transmittal, are required. Generally, this process is used when the excise return was established on AIMS using an electronic print and the original return was never requested. Form 2503, Survey After Assignment - Excise or Employment Tax, must also be prepared and included in the IMS case ﬁle for all surveyed returns.

, Examination Information when information of sufficient compliance value is received and warrants Excise another compliance action. Refer to IRM
, Form
, Information Report, for more detailed guidance. (
) Situations warranting the submission of Form

include, but are not to: • A related or non-related taxpayer having similar examination issues. • A referral of the taxpayer for non-excise related issues. Note: Information excise reports are not issued to the taxpayer. (

, ECS Data Assistance Requests, for procedural guidance regarding information reports for excise leads and non-excise (
) This section, in general, describes report writing guidelines. Writing (
) The excise examiner is required to utilize the Notebook Job Aid Notebook generates excise case reports, which must then be imported into Reports in Issue Management System (IMS). and the Issue (
) For additional guidance on Notebook, refer to IRM

, Guide for System Excise Tax Notebook, and the Excise Notebook Job Aid User Guide at the Excise Tax Knowledge Base Homepage, Excise Examination Shelf, an Examination Chapter, Notebook Book at Notebook, which provides ing instructions for the standard library of excise tax forms. (
) For additional guidance on IMS, refer to IRM

, Excise Issue ment System, and the LB&I Homepage, Computers and Technology at speciﬁc IMS areas of interest, such as IMS Help, IMS Team Website and Frequently Asked Questions. Also refer to the Excise Tax Knowledge Base Homepage, Excise Examination Shelf, Technical Assistance Chapter, Issue Management (IMS) System Book at IMS, which provides detailed instructions for IMS. (
) Notebook contains a library of standardized forms and letters. Based on mation input to Notebook and the selections made by the excise examiner, Notebook deploys the designated forms and letters. (

) Notebook prepares the Revenue Agent Report (RAR), which is mandatory. formation imported from the RAR into IMS automatically populates a number of documents based on data previously entered resulting in accuracy. (

) The excise examiner is responsible for selecting those forms and letters apply to the taxpayer’s situation (i.e., agreed, no change, etc.) and for importing these forms and letters into IMS. The excise examiner must complete those forms and letters with information that is not populated matically, as well as review them for report accuracy.
Refer to IRM 4.24.18.12, ECS Data Assistance Requests, for procedural guidance regarding information reports for excise leads and non-excise
) The excise examiner is required to utilize the Notebook Job Aid (Notebook). Notebook generates excise case reports, which must then be imported into the Issue Management System (IMS). (
) For additional guidance on Notebook, refer to IRM

, Guide for Using Excise Tax Notebook, and the Excise Notebook Job Aid User Guide at the Excise Tax Knowledge Base Homepage, Excise Examination Shelf, Initiating an Examination Chapter, Notebook Book at Notebook, which provides operat- ing instructions for the standard library of excise tax forms. ) For additional guidance on IMS, refer to IRM

, Excise Issue Manage- ment System, and the LB&I Homepage, Computers and Technology at IMS for speciﬁc IMS areas of interest, such as IMS Help, IMS Team Website and IMS Frequently Asked Questions. Also refer to the Excise Tax Knowledge Base Homepage, Excise Examination Shelf, Technical Assistance Chapter, Issue Management (IMS) System Book at IMS, which provides detailed operating instructions for IMS. (

) Notebook contains a library of standardized forms and letters. Based on infor- mation input to Notebook and the selections made by the excise examiner, Notebook deploys the designated forms and letters. (

) Notebook prepares the Revenue Agent Report (RAR), which is mandatory. In- formation imported from the RAR into IMS automatically populates a signiﬁcant number of documents based on data previously entered resulting in improved accuracy. (

) The excise examiner is responsible for selecting those forms and letters that apply to the taxpayer’s situation (i.e., agreed, no change, etc.) and for importing these forms and letters into IMS. The excise examiner must complete those forms and letters with information that is not populated auto- matically, as well as review them for report accuracy.
Tax Report Writing Guide 4.24.20
) The excise examiner is responsible to manually enter under IMS “Returns” each period and ﬁll in the tabs “ERCS Data”, “Issue Closing Data” and Closing Data” to generate closing documents Form
and Form

) The excise examiner must prepare all closing letters, addressed to the taxpayer and sent by Centralized Case Processing (CCP) when case closing completed. All closing letters must be generated in Notebook and imported IMS. (
) Separate reports reﬂecting changes are prepared based on the ﬁling type of excise return. For example, adjustments made to Form
, Quarterly Excise Reports Excise Tax Return, and Form
, Heavy Highway Vehicle Use Tax Return, Types of cannot be included on the same excise report. Taxes (

) A single excise report covering all periods examined will be prepared when same type of excise return was examined concurrently. Note: Separate excise reports for each period are prepared/required only if istrative action to close the case is due to exceptional circumstances. (
) When multiple tax abstracts are examined on the same excise return, each abstract must be listed separately on the excise report. (
) Excise tax adjustments must not be incorporated into income tax reports. (

must be provided to the taxpayer with the ﬁrst excise report given to the taxpayer and with all Letters
-E . b. Providing Pub

to the same taxpayer is not required for excise reports issued subsequent to the ﬁrst excise report (i.e., corrected and supplemental excise reports). c. Publications sent to the taxpayer should always agree with the enclo- sures listed on the cover letter. d. Publications are not required to be included with no change excise reports but must be included with no change with adjustments excise reports. (
) If a valid Form
, Power of Attorney and Declaration of Representative, (POA) or Form

, Tax Information Authorization, (TIA) is on ﬁle for a Reports Sent to taxpayer, granted authorities will be reviewed prior to the issuance of an Third Parties report to determine who should receive a copy of the excise report. (

, which veriﬁes that Centralized rization File (CAF) accepted the POA/TIA was posted on IDRS. It is possible

Tax Report Writing Guide 4.24.20
) On November

, a revision to the IRS’s fax policy was announced by the Deputy Commissioner for Services and Enforcement, which eliminated the dollar ceiling for acceptance by fax of consents to assess additional tax and taxpayer closing agreements. The amount was capped previously at $
With the revised fax policy, consents to assess additional tax and taxpayer closing agreements are now accepted by fax signature regardless of the dollar amount. This applies to Form
and Form

on Form

) Appeals procedures impose strict requirements pertaining to the time remaining on an SOL before an examination case may be referred. Prior to granting an extension of time for a taxpayer to respond, the excise must determine, if there is adequate time for forwarding a case to Appeals. the excise examiner is uncertain about the application of the Appeals ments to the taxpayer’s request, the excise examiner should consult the manager. Refer to IRM
for detailed information about the Appeals cedures. (
) The excise examiner should offer and secure an extension of the SOL to ensure Appeals eligibility requirements are met. (
) The steps and procedures described below apply only to situations where excise examiner conﬁrms there is sufficient time on the SOL, consistent with requirements established under Appeals. (
) As a matter of practice, under reasonable circumstances, requests for sions to respond may be granted. (

) Requests for extensions to respond must be in writing and should state the reason why additional time is needed. Since many requests are made by telephone, the extension may be granted verbally and conﬁrmed in writing upon receipt of the written request. (
) The excise examiner must issue Letter
-E, Letter Extending Time to File Protest - Excise, after the expiration of the
day period to allow the
more calendar days to respond. Letter
-E is used only if the
day period expired and the taxpayer has stated an intention to protest the tion results. (
) Extensions beyond the
day extension are granted by the excise manager a designated management official. The taxpayer must be notiﬁed in writing the approved extension and the speciﬁc extended response date. Letter
Note: Item 416 on Form 5344, Examination Closing Record, should contain a “1,” if a faxed agreement is received.

Documents, forms, letters and returns related to post-ﬁling inquiries and inter- actions can be allowed via fax unless if there is a speciﬁc prohibition. Refer to Revision of Policy Use of Fax and Signature Stamps in Taxpayer a memorandum dated November 19, 2015, and Clariﬁcation of Policy for Use of Fax in Taxpayer Submissions, a memorandum dated October 29, 2019.
Extension of Time for Certain Actions, is used for this purpose. Extensions normally granted for no more than
days unless supported by a speciﬁc reason. (
) If the taxpayer lives outside of the United States, the Letter
-E can be modiﬁed to allow for a reasonable period of time to respond. (
) If an excise report is changed after a Letter
-E response date is issued, excise examiner will follow corrected report procedures found in IRM

and solicit the taxpayer’s agreement. If the taxpayer does not agree to the corrected report, the excise examiner will take the following steps, as ate: a. If the corrected report changes the proposed adjustment in the favor and no new issues are raised, the examination can be closed after the initial
days expired. A new Letter
-E is not needed. b. If the corrected report raises new issue(s) or the proposed adjustment goes against the taxpayer (i.e., more tax due or less refund), a new Letter
-E will be issued, if sufficient time remains on the SOL. (

) The excise examiner should discuss payment options with the taxpayer the initial interview and again at the conclusion of the examination. Payment for agreed deﬁciency cases should be solicited and secured at the closing ference whenever possible. (

) The excise examiner will advise the taxpayer of the current interest rate and explain the advantage of making advance payment, (i.e., accrual of interest stop as of the date of payment). Generally, interest is computed by the excise examiner and provided to the taxpayer so full payment is received. (
) The excise examiner should utilize interest generating software programs, as CC COMPA for interest computations. Refer to IRM
, Interest, on Underpayments. (
) The excise examiner can accept payment by check or money order, but not cash. The check should be made payable to the U.S. Treasury. (
) The taxpayer has the right to designate any part of the advance payment, to penalty or interest, and the excise examiner must apply the payment as designated. (
) A separate Form
-A shall be prepared for each taxpayer and period. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

and Form
include references to CRNs for use, when warranted.
